</Array> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-9" value="<font face="Verdana" style="font-size: 16px;">This section deals with the practical challenges of extracting the necessary </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-10" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 20px;"><b>What computational model to use?</b></span></font>" <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-11" value="<font face="Verdana" style="font-size: 16px;">This area explores the theoretical and software foundation for the brain emulation itself.</font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;align=left;spacing=20;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="4383.5" y="-2534" width="312" height="111" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-12" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 20px;"><b>How to validate the simulation?</b></span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;spacing=20;align=left;fillColor=light-dark(#FFFFFF,#444444);" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="5513.5" y="-2616" width="297" height="82" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-56" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;strokeWidth=3;" parent="1" source="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-13" target="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-38" edge="1"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-57" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;entryX=0.5;entryY=0;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;strokeWidth=3;" parent="1" edge="1"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry"> <mxPoint x="5662" y="-2423" as="sourcePoint" /> <mxPoint x="6079" y="-2151" as="targetPoint" /> <Array as="points"> <mxPoint x="5662" y="-2277" /> <mxPoint x="6079" y="-2277" /> </Array> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-58" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;entryX=0.5;entryY=0;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;strokeWidth=3;" parent="1" source="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-13" target="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-36" edge="1"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry"> <Array as="points"> <mxPoint x="5662" y="-2277" /> <mxPoint x="5254" y="-2277" /> </Array> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-13" value="<font face="Verdana" style="font-size: 16px;">This final, critical section addresses how we would know if the emulation was successful.</font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;align=left;spacing=20;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="5513.5" y="-2534" width="297" height="112" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-14" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 20px;"><b>Connectome</b></span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;spacing=20;align=left;fillColor=light-dark(#EEEEEE,#444444);strokeColor=#36393d;gradientDirection=west;fillStyle=solid;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="2163" y="-2290" width="334" height="82" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-15" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 16px;">This question asks about the physical "wiring diagram" of the brain, or its connectome. It concerns mapping the three-dimensional position of every neuron and all of its connections to other neurons.</span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;align=left;spacing=20;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="2163" y="-2208" width="334" height="183" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-16" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 20px;"><b>Synaptome</b></span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;spacing=20;align=left;fillColor=light-dark(#000000,#444444);" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="2163" y="-1999" width="334" height="82" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-17" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 16px;">Going a level deeper than structure, this question deals with the specific properties of each synapse. This includes data on neurotransmitter types, receptor densities, and synaptic strength, which together determine how signals are passed between neurons.</span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;align=left;spacing=20;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="2163" y="-1917" width="334" height="189" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-18" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 20px;"><b>Proteome</b></span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;spacing=20;align=left;fillColor=light-dark(#FFFFFF,#444444);" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="2163" y="-1702" width="334" height="82" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-19" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 16px;">This addresses the need to map the complete set of proteins within each cell. Since proteins perform most cellular functions, this information would define the unique functional capabilities and state of every neuron.</span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;align=left;spacing=20;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="2163" y="-1620" width="334" height="170" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-20" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 20px;"><b>Transcriptome/Epigenome</b></span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;spacing=20;align=left;fillColor=light-dark(#FFFFFF,#444444);" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="2163" y="-1421" width="334" height="82" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-21" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 16px;">This question explores the state of gene expression. It's about identifying which genes are turned on or off in every neuron and the epigenetic modifications that control this activity, which determines the cell's long-term identity and potential for change.</span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;align=left;spacing=20;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="2163" y="-1339" width="334" height="200" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-22" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 20px;"><b>Dynamic state</b></span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;spacing=20;align=left;strokeColor=light-dark(#000000,#FFFFFF);fillColor=light-dark(#FFFFFF,#444444);" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="2163" y="-1106" width="334" height="82" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-23" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 16px;">This refers to capturing a "snapshot" of the brain's activity at a single moment in time. This includes the electrical membrane potential of every neuron and the concentration of key signaling molecules needed to "boot up" the emulation from where the biological brain left off.</span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;align=left;spacing=20;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="2163" y="-1024" width="334" height="205" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-24" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 20px;"><b>How can a human brain be preserved for scanning?</b></span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;spacing=20;align=left;fillColor=light-dark(#FFFFFF,#444444);" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="3135.5" y="-2148" width="339" height="93" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-90" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;entryX=0.5;entryY=0;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;strokeWidth=3;" parent="1" source="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-25" target="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-63" edge="1"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry"> <Array as="points"> <mxPoint x="3305" y="-1445" /> <mxPoint x="3202" y="-1445" /> </Array> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-91" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;entryX=0.5;entryY=0;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;strokeWidth=3;" parent="1" source="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-25" target="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-65" edge="1"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry"> <Array as="points"> <mxPoint x="3305" y="-1445" /> <mxPoint x="3572" y="-1445" /> </Array> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-25" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 16px;">This question tackles the first and most critical step: stopping decomposition. It explores methods like chemical fixation (e.g., using aldehydes) or vitrification (a form of flash-freezing that prevents ice crystal damage) to perfectly stabilize the delicate brain tissue for analysis.</span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;align=left;spacing=20;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="3135.5" y="-2055" width="339" height="183" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-26" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 20px;"><b>What combination of technologies can acquire the multi-modal data?</b></span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;spacing=20;align=left;fillColor=light-dark(#FFFFFF,#444444);" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="2780" y="-1825" width="349" height="93" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-92" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;entryX=0.5;entryY=0;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;strokeWidth=3;" parent="1" source="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-27" target="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-67" edge="1"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-27" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 16px;">This asks about the specific tools needed to gather all the different types of information. It involves figuring out how to combine technologies like high-resolution electron microscopy (for structure), mass spectrometry (for proteins), and advanced gene sequencing techniques (for the transcriptome/epigenome) into a cohesive workflow.</span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;align=left;spacing=20;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="2780" y="-1732" width="349" height="223" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-28" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 20px;"><b>How can the petabyte-to-zettabyte scale data be processed?</b></span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;spacing=20;align=left;fillColor=light-dark(#FFFFFF,#444444);" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="3516" y="-1821" width="326" height="93" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-93" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;entryX=0.5;entryY=0;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;strokeWidth=3;" parent="1" edge="1"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry"> <mxPoint x="3788.5" y="-1617" as="sourcePoint" /> <mxPoint x="3703" y="-987" as="targetPoint" /> <Array as="points"> <mxPoint x="3898" y="-1617" /> <mxPoint x="3898" y="-1060" /> <mxPoint x="3703" y="-1060" /> </Array> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-94" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;exitX=1;exitY=0.5;exitDx=0;exitDy=0;entryX=0.5;entryY=0;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;strokeWidth=3;" parent="1" edge="1"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry"> <mxPoint x="3787" y="-1617" as="sourcePoint" /> <mxPoint x="4088.5" y="-994" as="targetPoint" /> <Array as="points"> <mxPoint x="3898" y="-1617" /> <mxPoint x="3898" y="-1060" /> <mxPoint x="4088" y="-1060" /> </Array> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-29" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 16px;">A complete brain scan will produce an immense amount of raw data. This question focuses on the computational challenge of turning that data into a usable map, requiring powerful algorithms for image analysis, automated neuron tracing, data compression, and error correction.</span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;align=left;spacing=20;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="3516" y="-1728" width="326" height="222" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-30" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 20px;"><b>At what level of abstraction must the brain be simulated?</b></span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;spacing=20;align=left;fillColor=light-dark(#FFFFFF,#444444);" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="3994" y="-2150" width="368" height="82" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-95" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;entryX=0.5;entryY=0;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;strokeWidth=3;" parent="1" source="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-31" target="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-73" edge="1"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry"> <mxPoint x="4941.571428571429" y="-290.42857142857156" as="targetPoint" /> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-31" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 16px;">This is a crucial question about the necessary level of detail. Do we need to simulate every single molecule (high fidelity, immense computational cost), or is it sufficient to model neurons as simpler mathematical units that just fire or don't fire (low fidelity, more feasible)?</span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;align=left;spacing=20;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="3994" y="-2068" width="368" height="200" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-32" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 20px;"><b>How can a multi-scale model be constructed and run?</b></span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;spacing=20;align=left;fillColor=light-dark(#FFFFFF,#444444);" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="4595" y="-2150" width="363" height="82" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-96" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;entryX=0.5;entryY=0;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;strokeWidth=3;" parent="1" source="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-33" target="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-77" edge="1"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry"> <mxPoint x="5464.428571428572" y="-633.2857142857138" as="targetPoint" /> <Array as="points"> <mxPoint x="4777" y="-1059" /> <mxPoint x="4951" y="-1059" /> </Array> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-97" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;strokeWidth=3;" parent="1" source="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-33" target="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-75" edge="1"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry"> <Array as="points"> <mxPoint x="4777" y="-1059" /> <mxPoint x="4577" y="-1059" /> </Array> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-33" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 16px;">The brain's functions emerge from interactions across many scales (e.g., molecules, synapses, neurons, circuits). This question asks how to design a simulation where these different levels are modeled simultaneously and can influence each other realistically.</span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;align=left;spacing=20;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="4595" y="-2068" width="363" height="200" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-34" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 20px;"><b>What hardware is capable of running the emulation?</b></span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;spacing=20;align=left;fillColor=light-dark(#FFFFFF,#444444);" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="4367" y="-1830" width="345" height="82" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-98" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;endSize=6;strokeWidth=3;" parent="1" source="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-35" target="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-79" edge="1"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-35" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 16px;">This is about the physical computer system required to run the simulation. It questions whether today's supercomputers are adequate or if fundamentally new computer architectures, such as neuromorphic hardware (chips designed to mimic the brain's structure), are necessary for the task.</span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;align=left;spacing=20;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="4367" y="-1748" width="345" height="200" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-36" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 20px;"><b>How can we validate structural and low-level functional equivalence?</b></span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;spacing=20;align=left;fillColor=light-dark(#FFFFFF,#444444);" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="5098" y="-2150" width="312" height="93" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-99" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;strokeWidth=3;" parent="1" source="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-37" target="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-83" edge="1"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry"> <Array as="points"> <mxPoint x="5254" y="-1387" /> <mxPoint x="5481" y="-1387" /> </Array> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-100" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;strokeWidth=3;" parent="1" source="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-37" target="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-81" edge="1"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry"> <Array as="points"> <mxPoint x="5254" y="-1387" /> <mxPoint x="5082" y="-1387" /> </Array> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-37" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 16px;">This question is about verifying the building blocks of the emulation. It involves comparing the digital connectome to the original biological map and testing whether small, simulated neural circuits respond to stimuli in the same way as their biological counterparts would.</span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;align=left;spacing=20;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="5098" y="-2057" width="312" height="222" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-38" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 20px;"><b>How can we validate behavioral and cognitive equivalence?&nbsp;</b></span></font>" style="rounded=0;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;spacing=20;align=left;fillColor=light-dark(#FFFFFF,#444444);" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="5496.5" y="-2150" width="331" height="93" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-101" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;strokeWidth=3;" parent="1" source="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-39" target="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-85" edge="1"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-102" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;strokeWidth=3;" parent="1" source="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-39" target="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-87" edge="1"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="xY5mzQrniyS0lYiVM-2u-39" value="<font face="Verdana"><span style="font-size: 16px;">Moving from parts to the whole, this asks how to confirm the emulation acts like the original person.
